stimulusHtml: Which of the following best accounts for the difference between Volpedo's and Jansen's perspectives on industrial workers’ role in society reflected in the two paintings?

features.html:
Image 1: Giuseppe Pelizza da Volpedo, Italian painter, The Fourth Estate, showing industrial workers on strike, 1901

Alinari/ Art Resource, NY

Image 2: Franz M. Jansen, German painter, etching of factory workers reporting for work, 1921

Digital Image © 2014 Museum Associates / LACMA. Licensed by Art Resource, NY

choicesHtml: The widespread disillusionment and erosion of the notion of progress as a result of the First World War
The boost to socialist movements in western Europe as a result of the success of the Bolshevik Revolution in Russia
The detrimental economic and social effects of the Great Depression
The arrival of large numbers of guest workers from eastern Europe and former colonies
